issue.body:
When switching to a fullscreen window with a lower resolution than the regular desktop resolution and the mouse cursor outside of the new fullscreen window I would expect that the cursor is moved within the bounds of the fullscreen window.

At least on the X11 backend this behaviour isn't the case.

body: `GLFW_CURSOR_CAPTURED` has been implemented for Windows and X11. OS X has turned out to be trickier.
@jadahl Is this possible to implement on Wayland?

Not right now. There might be a "pointer lock" interface coming, but nothing has been adopted yet. With such a protocol it could be implemented by drawing the cursor and keeping it within the window ourself.
This cannot be properly implemented on Wayland and is difficult to do on macOS. Closing this until the universe improves.

Actually this is already implementable on Wayland, since cb08dc574c55626460eb4860652f4de03fa2b0eb added support for pointer-constraints.

It is only implemented for GLFW_CURSOR_DISABLED though.
@linkmauve Wayland now allows constraining the system cursor to a window client area?
Yes, or even to a specific region of it. It’s currently used for GLFW_CURSOR_DISABLED in tandem with relative-pointer to prevent the pointer from leaving the client area.

To clarify, what cb08dc5 does is lock the pointer using "wp_pointer_constraints.lock_pointer" so that it can no longer move while in 'disabled' mode. A 'captured' mode would instead use "wp_pointer_constraints.confine_pointer" which would confine it to a given region.

As far as I know, on macOS you have to do this manually.

Inside the `- (void)mouseMoved:(NSEvent *)event` event handler, if the mouse position strays outside of the client area, you must first re-position it so that it is back inside the client area by calling `CGWarpMouseCursorPosition(updatedPosition)` and then call `CGAssociateMouseAndMouseCursorPosition(YES)` move the cursor to the updated mouse position.

Here's Apple's documentation for these functions:

https://developer.apple.com/reference/coregraphics/1456387-cgwarpmousecursorposition?language=objc
https://developer.apple.com/reference/coregraphics/1454486-cgassociatemouseandmousecursorpo?language=objc
It is reportedly possible using [event taps](https://developer.apple.com/reference/coregraphics/quartz_event_services), but only for non-store applications.
